revised_title: Spectrum Analysis of Comet Wells in 1882
tldr: The author analyzes the photographic spectrum of the comet Wells in 1882 and discovers that it differs significantly from the hydrocarbon type of previous comets. The comet's spectrum contains bright lines, presumably of sodium vapor, and other bright lines or groups of lines. The continuous spectrum extends from below F to a little beyond H, and the author is unable to see the cyanogen group in the ultraviolet region.
